vex_lines.text: Vex whispers: the lanterns are bickering again, so light them with compliments.
Vex notes: a crab stole a pastry and now runs a tiny bakery under the pier.
Vex hums: the bridge boards squeak in approval when you tell the truth.
Vex chirps: a fox courier is practicing dramatic bows in the market.
Vex sighs: the river is gossiping about a missing key, as usual.
Vex cackles: a broom just won an argument with the wind.
Vex warns: moon-moths are chewing on forgotten wishes tonight.
Vex murmurs: a statue winked at noon, and the pigeons blushed.
Vex intones: the bell tower tried to sneeze. It rang instead.
Vex proclaims: the market is haggling with the sun today.

rumor_seeds.text: They say a cat council met at the bakery and voted for more crumbs.
A candle merchant is selling shadows by the yard, and they smell like pepper.
The apples are rolling on their own to escape the pie contest.
Thorn swears a ghost posted a babysitting notice by the docks.
A mermaid tried to bargain for boots and promised pearls later.
The tide keeps whispering a different name at dawn.
The bell tower hums when someone tells a half-truth.
A prayer scroll flew out the window and is looking for its reader.
A priest's candle refuses to go out until it hears a good joke.
The guild ledger is writing its own footnotes again.
A knight misplaced their bravery and is retracing their steps.
The training yard is accepting apologies in lieu of fees.
There is a secret door behind the tavern dartboard, allegedly.
The minstrel forgot a verse, and now the wind won't stop humming it.
Someone traded three jokes for a box of moon-salt.
Festival drums were heard two days early, and the sky blushed.
A fox courier delivered a letter addressed to 'Tomorrow'.
The statue in the courtyard asked for a story last night.
Bandits repainted the signposts as a gesture of remorse.
A traveling chef is swapping recipes for storm stories.

merchant_personalities.name: Bibble the Barterer
sample_lines: Lanterns for 12 coins, and they hum in three keys.
Haggle gently; my wares are shy.

merchant_personalities.name: Sera of Many Hats
sample_lines: Hats for 7 coins, each with a secret pocket.
Two hats, one story, no refunds.

merchant_personalities.name: Thorny Keg
sample_lines: My prices don't lie, but my bells do.

merchant_personalities.name: Lysa the Laughing
sample_lines: Cloaks for 20, and they like compliments.
Tell me a joke and I'll shave a coin.

merchant_personalities.name: Morrow the Quiet
sample_lines: Potions for 14; they keep their own secrets.
Pay now, or pay in riddles.

merchant_personalities.name: Edda Spark
sample_lines: Goggles for 9; they see through fog and fibs.
Winds are high, prices are higher.

merchant_personalities.name: Corin Riverhand
sample_lines: Fishing hooks for 4, and they sing to the river.
Trade me a promise and a smile.

npc_memories: Helped Mira coax a stubborn lantern back to life; she remembers the warm flicker.
Argued with Thorn about a missing crate; trust dimmed like tidewater.
Shared soup with Lysa; the tavern glowed brighter afterward.
Saved Pip's basket from a runaway cart; he owes a favor.
Listened to Edda's invention pitch; curiosity sparked.
Misplaced a delivery; Corin sighed but forgave.
Told a joke to the temple statue; it smiled in stone.
Paid for repairs without haggling; the smith nodded approvingly.
Caught a rumor from a fox courier; the alley cats listened.
Traded a song for a map; the minstrel called it fair.
Offered a coin to the laughing pond; it giggled louder.
Apologized to the broom; it stopped sweeping your boots.
encounter_seeds: A wagon of turnips tips over and rolls toward a dozing guard.
Opinionated geese demand a riddle toll at the bridge.
A tiny storm cloud drizzles coins over a single cart.
An animated broom circles a glowing pebble like a guardian.
Bandits rehearse an apology song by the roadside.
A courier fox demands a signature on a moss-sealed letter.
A pond bubbles with laughter, inviting a wager.
Festival lanterns drift the wrong direction, luring a crowd away.
A statue steps down to stretch and asks for a story.
A scarf with an embroidered warning arrives on the wind.
weather_states: Mist that smells faintly of cinnamon
Thunder that grumbles like a hungry cat
Wind that keeps rearranging the market signs
storylets: An alley cat offers a side quest in exchange for compliments.
A baker insists their bread predicts the weather, loudly and incorrectly.
A street performer juggles glowing stones and asks for a name in return.
A chalk spiral on the bridge hums when you step near it.
A tiny door appears in the market fountain for exactly one minute.
The tavern hearth crackles in a rhythm that sounds like a warning.
A guild notice refuses to be read until you say please.
A temple bell rings whenever someone tells the truth twice.
A lantern drifts against the wind as if it has a destination.
A dock rope unties itself to chase a spilled bucket of fish.
A bell tower shadow points somewhere it shouldn't.
A cart of hats migrates on its own toward the plaza.
